pullRequest.body:
From FLT. Binary and finite products of modules with the module topology also have the module topology. 

---

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

### PR summary [47082f17fd](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20453/commits/47082f17fd2b073630464db4e945e880b0be75ca)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ pi`
`+ prod`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Looks great, thanks! Just a bunch of nitpicks.

I might add that I think it's a bit crazy that we have to write proofs like the `instPi` one here manually. I wonder who could write a tactic for this?

bors d+

Looks great, thanks! Just a bunch of nitpicks.

I might add that I think it's a bit crazy that we have to write proofs like the `instPi` one here manually. I wonder who could write a tactic for this?

bors d+

```suggestion
  -- But `i` can be written as (m, n)  (m, 0) + (0, n)
```

```suggestion
variable {M : Type*} [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] [TopologicalSpace M] [IsModuleTopology R M]
variable {N : Type*} [AddCommMonoid N] [Module R N] [TopologicalSpace N] [IsModuleTopology R N]
```

```suggestion
  have : ContinuousAdd M := toContinuousAdd R M
  have : ContinuousAdd N := toContinuousAdd R N
```

```suggestion
  let P : TopologicalSpace P := moduleTopology R P
  have : IsModuleTopology R P := rfl
  have : ContinuousAdd P := ModuleTopology.continuousAdd R P
```

I think this helps clarify a bit:
```suggestion
  change @Continuous (M  N) P instTopologicalSpaceProd P i
```

```suggestion
instance instProd : IsModuleTopology R (M  N) := by
```

```suggestion
instance instPi : IsModuleTopology R ( i, A i) := by
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Algebra/Module/ModuleTopology): finite products of modules.
